resources.string: If we list all the natural numbers below 10 that are multiples of 3 or 5, we get 3, 5, 6 and 9. The sum of these multiples is 23. \n\nEnter a number to find the sum of all multiples of 3 and 5 that are less than it.
The prime factors of 13195 are 5, 7, 13 and 29. \n\nEnter a number to find its largest prime factor.

A palindromic number reads the same both ways. The largest palindrome made from the product of two 2-digit numbers is 9009 = 91 × 99. 
Find the largest palindrome made from the product of two n-digit numbers. 

*Note: The largest n-digit allowed is 7.

The sum of the squares of the first ten natural numbers is, 1^2 + 2^2 + … + 10^2 = 385 
The square of the sum of the first ten natural numbers is, (1 + 2 + … + 10)^2 = 55^2 = 3025 
Hence the difference between the sum of the squares of the first ten natural numbers and the square of the sum is 3025 − 385 = 2640. 

Enter in a list of numbers separated by spaces.
